instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no S5 rails - booting in Recovery
threads.message:
I'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A which came with a diagnosis of liquid damage. The liquid damage was treated unprofessionally and the indications of the damaged areas have largely disappeared. A few areas was untouched and still corroded ...
- RB631, RB641 The pads of <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was gone, i made a jumper wire
- arround <CHIP>U8800</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C8832</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C8848</CAPACITOR> etc.
- <CAPACITOR>C9080</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C9081</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C9074</CAPACITOR>, Testpad <SIGNAL>OFPPBUS_G3H_SSD0_SNS</SIGNAL> near <CAPACITOR>C9081</CAPACITOR>/1
-  arround <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C8948</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C8932</CAPACITOR>
- <CHIP>U9419</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C4916</CAPACITOR>
- DB528, DB554, DB549, L8504 was ripped off

The board stucks at 65mA and is booting into Recovery Mode. Recovery is alway stopping at step4 with an error message like ...
AMRestoreErrorDomain-Fehler -1 - Failed to handle message type StatusMsg (Generic error)) [AMRestoreErrorDomain – 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF (-1) [sys = 0x3F, sub = 0xFFF, code = 0x3FFF (16383)]

The S5 rails are missing. The SSD rails are ok, here are my measurements ...
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> = 2.52v
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD0</SIGNAL> = 9.00v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> = 1.80v

If it would help i can give informations from thermal cam - what gets warm while Recovering.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no S5 rails - booting in Recovery
threads.message:
Very likely more damage caused by corrosion.
I suspect SSD problems...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no S5 rails - booting in Recovery
threads.message:
I was able to fix the board. I made a mistake trying to restore the naked board outside the machine. This is probably not possible - I did not know that.
After installing the board and connecting everything, the recovery went through without errors and I was able to reinstall the system.

Maybe I'm the only idiot trying to restore a naked board. Otherwise this information may help someone else.
